answers.text: the creation of the first industrial research laboratory

qas.question: What Did Thomas Edison switch to in 1882?

answers.text: the world's first large-scale electrical supply network

qas.question: How many volts did Thomas Edison's electrical supply provide?
How many customers were supplied by Thomas Edison's electrical supply network?
Where was Thomas Edison's electrical supply network located?

context: In the latter part of the second revolution, Thomas Alva Edison developed many devices that greatly influenced life around the world and is often credited with <a0_0>the creation of the first industrial research laboratory<a0_0/>. In 1882, Edison switched on <a1_0>the world's first large-scale electrical supply network<a1_0/> that provided <a2_0>110 volts<a2_0/> direct current to <a3_0>fifty-nine<a3_0/> customers in <a4_0>lower Manhattan<a4_0/>. Also toward the end of the second industrial revolution, Nikola Tesla made many contributions in the field of electricity and magnetism in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
